Class.name: TWReader.Lister
Class.Description:
This is a very simple Lister implementation to retrieve Twitter posts' texts. The Lister will download posts through a API request and store the set of items retrieved as separate Sources.

Lister Parameters to be supplied to AddListToBatch and ProcessList calls:

  1. query As %String - The query to search through vk newsfeed. fe: "pizza"
  2. count As %Integer - The positive integer number of posts (from 1 to 100) to add.
  3. checkExists As %Boolean - Whether or not to check whether a post item already exists before attempting to store it (skipping if it exists), default 1
  4. startDate As %Date - The starting date value to search posts from.
  5. startTime As %Time - The starting time value to search posts from.
  6. endDate As %Date - The ending date value to search posts to.
  7. endTime As %Time - The ending time value to search posts to.

External ID structure: [GroupName]:::[LocalRef]

  • GroupName = query
  • LocalRef = OwnerID#FromID#PostID

Extracted metadata: these metadata fields will be populated with corresponding values for each post item, where present.

  • PostDate
  • PostTime
  • AuthorID
  • AuthorCity
  • AuthorCountry
  • AuthorDOB
  • AuthorSex

Lister alias: "TwitterAPI"

Default Processor: %iKnow.Source.Temp.Processor

Method.name: ExpandList
Method.Description:
Fires an API request to retrieve the list of VKReader.Data.Post objects and then finds the Text items therein, storing them locally through StoreTemp calls. If they exist in the domain, this Lister will also retrieve and populate mentioned above metadata fields. In order to do this Lister will fire an API request again to retrieve all corresponding (to metafields) information.

See also ExpandList in %iKnow.Source.Lister.
Method.Implementation:
set query = $li(listparams, 1) set count = $li(listparams, 2) set checkExists = +$lg(listparams, 3, 1) set startDate = $lg(listparams, 4) set startTime = $lg(listparams, 5) set endDate = $lg(listparams, 6) set endTime = $lg(listparams, 7) //set requestType = "popular"
set status = ##class(TWReader.Requests.APIMethodsCaller).TweetsSearch(.response, listparams) quit:$$$ISERR(status) status
do ..RegisterMetadataKeys($lb("Query", "PostDate", "PostTime", "AuthorID", "AuthorCity", "AuthorCountry", "PostLatitude", "PostLongitude"))
set tweets = ##class(%ArrayOfObjects).%New() set tweets = response.GetAt(1)."statuses"
for i = 1:1:tweets.Count() { #dim tweet As TWReader.Data.Tweet = ##class(TWReader.Data.Tweet).%New(tweets.GetAt(i)) #dim user As TWReader.Data.User = ##class(TWReader.Data.User).%New(tweet.User) /* write:(tweet.Coordinates'="") "coords = "_tweet.Coordinates ,!
s:(tweet.Coordinates'="") ^Test(i) = $system.OBJ.Dump(tweet.Coordinates) write:(tweet.Coordinates'="") "latitude = "_tweet.Coordinates."coordinates".GetAt(1) ,! write:(tweet.Coordinates'="") "longitude = "_tweet.Coordinates."coordinates".GetAt(2) ,! */ set tPostDate = $piece(tweet.CreatedAtDateTime,",",1) set tPostTime = $piece(tweet.CreatedAtDateTime,",",2) set tOwnerID = user.IdStr set tID = tweet.IdStr #dim tTextStream as %GlobalCharacterStream set tTextStream = tweet.Text
set tAuthorCity = user.Location set tAuthorCountry = user.WithheldInCountries set tLatitude = "" set tLongitude = "" set:(tweet.Coordinates'="") tLatitude = tweet.Coordinates."coordinates".GetAt(2) set:(tweet.Coordinates'="") tLongitude = tweet.Coordinates."coordinates".GetAt(1)
set tLocalRef = tOwnerID_"#"_tID
set tRef = $lb(i%ListerClassId, ..AddGroup(query), tLocalRef) do tTextStream.Rewind() if (tTextStream.Size = 0) { continue } set len = 32000 while (len = 32000) { do ..StoreTemp(tRef, tTextStream.Read(.len)) }
do ..SetMetadataValues(tRef, $lb(query, tPostDate, tPostTime, tID, tAuthorCity, tAuthorCountry, tLatitude, tLongitude)) }
quit $$$OK

Method.name: SplitFullRef
Method.Description:
Identifies the ":::" separator and takes whatever comes before as the group name and the second part as local reference.

See also SplitFullRef in %iKnow.Source.Lister.
Method.Implementation: set delim = ":::" set localRef = $piece(fullRef, delim, $l(fullRef, delim)) set groupName = $e(fullRef, 1, *-$l(localRef)-$l(delim)) Quit $$$OK

Method.name: BuildFullRef
Method.Description:
Builds the full ref by appending the group name and local reference, adding a triple colon in between.

See also BuildFullRef in %iKnow.Source.Lister.

Method.name: DefaultProcessor
Method.Description: This Lister uses %iKnow.Source.Temp.Processor, as all VK API content here won't be saved to database, but will be saved locally through StoreTemp calls.
